definitions: To cancel or refrain from exacting or inflicting (a debt or punishment).
To send back (a case) to a lower court for further action.
To diminish or abate in intensity.
To pardon or forgive (a sin or offense).
examples: Please remit payment by the due date.
The court decided to remit the fine.
The appellate court will remit the case.
The storm began to remit after an hour.
He prayed for God to remit his sins.
